function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Wearable may not accurately measure respiratory rates, leading to false notifications and undermining user trust.","Impact":"Users may ignore or distrust notifications, reducing the effectiveness of the device in alerting individuals to potential health issues.","Mitigation":"Regular calibration and validation of the wearable's respiratory rate measurements, and providing clear information to users about the limitations of the device.","Technologies":"Biometric validation technology, real-time data monitoring and analysis.","People":"Individual wearers of the device.","Owner":"Manufacturer, healthcare professionals."},{"Description":"Data collection from wearable devices may raise privacy concerns and lead to misuse of personal health information.","Impact":"Users may be hesitant to use the device, leading to limited adoption and effectiveness of workplace health monitoring.","Mitigation":"Implement strict data protection measures, such as anonymization of data and transparent consent processes for data collection.","Technologies":"Secure data encryption, anonymization algorithms, and transparent data privacy policies.","People":"Employees wearing the device, organization leaders implementing the device.","Owner":"Organization leaders, IT professionals."},{"Description":"The use of workplace contact tracing wearables may create a sense of surveillance and distrust among employees.","Impact":"Employees may feel uncomfortable and monitored, leading to decreased morale and potential resistance to using the device.","Mitigation":"Transparent communication about the purpose of the device, emphasizing its role in maintaining a safe workplace environment rather than surveillance.","Technologies":"Anonymous data collection, opt-in/opt-out features, and clear privacy policies.","People":"Employees wearing the device, organization leaders implementing the device.","Owner":"Organization leaders, HR professionals."}]}
